column1: # SOURCE: JinkoSolar Tiger Neo JKM580N-72HL4 datasheet (2024); Trina Solar Vertex N TSM-585NEG18C.20 datasheet (2024); PVsyst v8 thermal model (Mermoud & Lejeune
column2: 2010); PVGIS v5.3 (EU JRC); Khatib et al.
column3: "Comprehensive assessment of performance and reliability of PERC
column4: TOPCon and SHJ modules in desert climates
column5: Solar Energy 295:113555 (2025); IEA-PVPS T13-30:2025 Degradation and Failure Modes in New PV Cell and Module Technologies"; NREL PV degradation rates meta-analysis (Jordan & Kurtz
column6: 2012); Aurora Solar system loss guides (2024); IEA-PVPS T13-21:2022 soiling losses report; Sandia PVPMC cell temperature models; pvlib-python v0.15 PVsyst temperature model implementation

column1: # DESCRIPTION: PV system specifications for agri-PV installation at 3 density levels
column3: BWh hot desert climate). N-type TOPCon monocrystalline panels elevated 3.5m for agri-PV crop clearance.

column1: # LOGIC: All densities use N-type TOPCon panels (22.5% module efficiency)
column2: representative of JinkoSolar Tiger Neo 580W and Trina Vertex N 585W class modules widely deployed in 2024-2025. Density affects ground coverage ratio
column5: and maintenance access (soiling losses). Tilt angle 25 deg optimized for year-round generation at 28N per PVGIS (optimal = lat*0.76+3.1 = 24.4 deg
column6: rounded to 25). Tilt factor 1.10 from PVGIS comparison of GTI at 25 deg tilt vs GHI at 28N latitude (~10% annual gain). System losses include inverter (~3%)
column9: and soiling/dust in desert environment (4-6% with monthly cleaning; higher density = harder access = more accumulation). Panels per kW = 1000/580 = 1.72. Degradation 0.6%/yr based on NREL desert field studies showing 0.5-0.7%/yr for mono-Si in hot climates with NREL finding +0.15%/yr per 10C above temperate baseline. Shading factor is annual average PV inter-row shading retention: GCR 0.30 has minimal shading (~2% loss)
column10: GCR 0.50 has moderate morning/evening shading (~5% loss)
column11: GCR 0.80 has significant shading (~13% loss) per PVsyst ray-tracing models for fixed-tilt at low latitudes. temp_reference_c is the STC reference temperature (25C). temp_adjustment_c is the daily-average cell-to-ambient temperature offset derived from two independent models: (1) PVsyst thermal model T_c = T_a + alpha*G*(1-eta)/U_c with alpha=0.9
column13: G=275 W/m2 (24h average GTI for Sinai)
column14: and density-dependent U_c values (29/24/19 W/m2/K for low/med/high based on ventilation reduction from freestanding to semi-integrated); (2) NOCT model delta_T = (NOCT-20)*(G/800)*f_vent with NOCT=45C and ventilation adjustment factors (0.90/1.10/1.40). Final values are the mean of both methods. irradiance_factor is 1.0 for all densities (panels are the highest obstruction; no overhead shading).

column1: # ASSUMPTIONS: Fixed-tilt south-facing installation at 25 deg; 3.5m panel clearance for agricultural equipment and crop growth; hot desert environment (BWh) with regular dust accumulation requiring monthly cleaning; wind speed 3.5-4.5 m/s annual average at site; N-type TOPCon technology selected for superior temperature coefficient (-0.29 to -0.30%/C) and lower degradation vs PERC in hot climates per Qatar 3-year field study (Khatib et al. 2025). Temperature coefficient -0.0030/C is conservative for TOPCon (datasheets show -0.0029/C) to account for field aging. Module efficiency 22.5% represents commercial mean of 580W-class TOPCon (JinkoSolar 22.45%
column2: Trina 22.8%). Panel dimensions 2278x1134mm (2.58 m2) per JinkoSolar Tiger Neo 72HL4 datasheet.

column1: # CONTEXT: Panel type: N-type TOPCon monocrystalline (tunnel oxide passivated contact). Use case: Agri-PV installation in Sinai Peninsula
column2: Egypt. Reference panels: JinkoSolar Tiger Neo JKM580N-72HL4 (580W
column9: temp coeff -0.29%/C). Climate: BWh hot desert
